link.title: Coronavirus Information
link.script:

div.style: background-size: cover; background-position: center center; background-image: url(https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/51YWCNhHiafsrJZQT1gUxPHmxZQ89xSm4asKowRcf8T7XJyB8LyBB-G2CI6cAYMukNobat4IXw=w16383);

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

span.strong: The State of Indiana has closed all schools for the rest of the school year.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Thank you for your patience as we continue to monitor and adjust to this fluid situation with COVID-19. Protecting the health of our students, faculty, staff, and the entire community is a priority for us while we balance the importance of educating our students during these extended eLearning days. Information will be updated on this web page as it becomes available.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: The Coronavirus pandemic is an unprecedented event for all of us. South Madison School Corporation understands that this situation has created a great deal of stress for many of our students, parents, and employees. In addition, it may create an unfair or uneven educational environment for many of our students. In particular, students with poor or no internet access at home and students requiring additional support are at a disadvantage academically.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: To help level the playing field and reduce stress for students, parents, and employees, the district has developed the following plan for the remainder of the school year.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Schools must provide 160 days of instruction to complete the 2019-2020 school year. SMCSC has 22 days of instruction remaining to meet this requirement. The eLearning days will continue to be Wednesday - Friday each week for the remainder of the school year. In order to end the school year before Memorial Day, the last week of school will have four (4) eLearning days, Tuesday, May 19 - Friday, May 22. The last eLearning day and the end of the 2019-2020 school year will be Friday, May 22nd.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Following participation and completion of 160 days of instruction, students will be awarded an A+ for the classes they are enrolled in for the 4th quarter. The second-semester grade will be calculated by averaging the 3rd quarter and the 4th quarter grades. No final exam will be given for the second semester. By executive order of the Governor and State Superintendent of Instruction, all 12th-grade students who were on track to graduate, and enrolled in the classes needed to graduate, will earn their diploma.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students will be awarded either an A+ or F for the classes they are enrolled in for the 4th quarter. If a student participates and performs well enough to get a passing grade they will receive an A+. The second-semester grade will be calculated by averaging the 3rd and 4th quarter grades. No final exam will be given for the second semester.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students will be awarded mastery levels on select standards based on the high priority standards.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: At this time no decision has been made regarding commencement due to Indiana’s Stay at Home Executive Order and the possibility of an extension of the order. In the event that a traditional commencement ceremony can not be held, the district is exploring alternative options. The district plans to recognize the achievements of the Class of 2020. Plans will be determined at a later date.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: Return of Chromebook and District Owned Materials:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: At this time no decision has been made regarding the return of Chromebooks and district owned materials due to Indiana’s Stay at Home Executive Order and the possibility of an extension of the order. Plans will be shared at a later date.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: At this time Kindergarten Round Up and Blast Off have been postponed. No decision has been made regarding dates due to Indiana’s Stay at Home Executive Order. When the new dates have been scheduled, we will provide information at that time.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Spring registration for next school year will start next Monday April 13th. To register your student for next school year go to

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: The next meal service pick up: Tuesday April 28th - 1:00 to 2:00 PM

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: SMCSC families can receive FREE breakfasts and lunches for any child in the household, ages 0-18. Each elementary will have a once per week pickup window in which families can drive through and receive a meal bag for each child that includes 5 lunches and 5 breakfasts. For more information click here.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: All state assessments have been cancelled for this spring. State assessments include IREAD3, ISTEP+, ILEARN, IAM, ISPROUT, & WIDA. More information from the department of education can be found here.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Social-Emotional Learning and Mental Health Resources can be found here.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: The district would like to provide parents, guardians, and caregivers with a list of FREE resources t use to engage your children beyond their school days. More Information can be found here.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Non-Resident Student Applications for the 2020-21 school year are being accepted until April 24th. During the time of closure, applications need to be mailed to the district office: 203 South Heritage Way, Pendleton IN 46064. More information regarding the application process for Non-Resident Students can be found here.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you need to communicate with a specific staff member, an email will be the best method during this closure. Staff email addresses can be found in the staff directory on each school’s web page.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
